Package org.numpy4j.activations

Interface ActivationFunction

Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public interface ActivationFunction
Represents an activation function applied to an NDArray.

An activation function is a stateless, pure transformation that maps an input NDArray to a new NDArray of the same shape.

This interface is a FunctionalInterface and is intended to be used with lambdas or method references.

Contract

  • The implementation must not modify the input NDArray.
  • The returned NDArray must have the same shape as the input.
  • The implementation must be free of side effects.

Typical usage

Standard activation functions can be referenced from the Activations utility class: 

 ActivationFunction relu = Activations::relu;
 ActivationFunction sigmoid = Activations::sigmoid;
Custom activation functions can be defined using lambdas: 

 ActivationFunction leakyRelu = x -> {
     double[] in = x.getData();
     double[] out = new double[in.length];

     for (int i = 0; i < in.length; i++) {
         double v = in[i];
         out[i] = v > 0 ? v : 0.01 * v;
     }
     return x.like(out);
 };

This interface is typically used as a strategy for neural network layers, allowing activation behavior to be configured without inheritance or conditional logic.
